dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, we've got to talk about Nikola, right? This company is, uh, making a huge splash on Wall Street. Like, it's being compared to Tesla's debut a decade ago.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we've got to talk about Nikola, right? This company is, uh, making a huge splash on Wall Street. Like, it's being compared to Tesla's debut a decade ago.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With plans to shake up commercial trucking with zero-emission vehicles and fuel, its the most audacious Wall Street debut for a high-tech transportation startup since Teslas a decade ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. They just went public through, like, a reverse merger with VectoIQ, which is an acquisition firm, you know, led by Steve Girsky, a former Ford guy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. They just went public through, like, a reverse merger with Vecto I Q, which is an acquisition firm, you know, led by Steve Girsky, a former Ford guy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The reverse merger with publicly traded VectoIQ, an acquisition firm created by former General Motors GM Vice Chairman Steve Girsky, was announced March 3, just ahead of the Covid-19 shutdown.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, Girsky! And, um, their founder, Trevor Milton, he's stepping down as CEO but staying on as executive chairman. Big move.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, Girsky! And, um, their founder, Trevor Milton, he's stepping down as C E O but staying on as executive chairman. Big move.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We're full steam ahead, says Nikola founder Trevor Milton, whos giving up his CEO role with the merger to become executive chairman.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And the ticker, NKLA, it's trading now after, like, this huge build-up. Milton is saying they're "full steam ahead."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And the ticker, N K L A, it's trading now after, like, this huge build-up. Milton is saying they're full steam ahead.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of the combined new company start trading Thursday with the ticker NKLA. ... We're full steam ahead, says Nikola founder Trevor Milton

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Full steam ahead indeed! They're talking about production of their electric Tre trucks starting in South Korea next year, 2021.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Full steam ahead indeed! They're talking about production of their electric Tre trucks starting in South Korea next year, twenty twenty one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Production of electric Nikola Tre trucks starts in Europe in 2021 with partner CNH/Iveco, with some units to be exported to the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Next year! Yeah, and then Arizona the year after for, like, their US factory, building both battery and hydrogen models. He says they're "kicking ass."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Next year! Yeah, and then Arizona the year after for, like, their U S factory, building both battery and hydrogen models. He says they're kicking ass.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Production of electric Nikola Tre trucks starts in Europe in 2021 with partner CNH/Iveco, with some units to be exported to the U.S., ahead of the opening of Nikolas U.S. factory that will build both battery and hydrogen fuel cell models. We have trucks coming out of Ulm, Germany, in full production next year, and then the year after here in Arizona... We're kicking ass.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Kicking ass!" That's, uh, quite the boast. And they've got these huge ambitions, right? Like, zero-emission vehicles, hydrogen fuel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kicking ass! That's, uh, quite the boast. And they've got these huge ambitions, right? Like, zero-emission vehicles, hydrogen fuel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With plans to shake up commercial trucking with zero-emission vehicles and fuel, its the most audacious Wall Street debut for a high-tech transportation startup since Teslas a decade ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But, you know, they do need a *lot* more funding. They're talking about raising, like, another $700 million in equity, plus debt later.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But, you know, they do need a lot more funding. They're talking about raising, like, another seven hundred million dollars in equity, plus debt later.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company estimates it will need to raise an additional $700 million of equity financing between late 2021 and early 2022, according to an SEC filing. Additionally, it will probably issue debt in 2023 and 2024 totaling $500 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, to build the plant, and then, um, a whole network of hydrogen fueling stations. That's a billion-dollar investment right there, just for the stations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, to build the plant, and then, um, a whole network of hydrogen fueling stations. That's a billion-dollar investment right there, just for the stations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Spending on hydrogen stations, which will make the clean fuel from water and renewable electricity, will run to nearly $1 billion from 2022 through 2024, according to the filing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a massive undertaking. But they *do* have, like, secured orders, five billion dollars worth, including Coca-Cola wanting 800 trucks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a massive undertaking. But they do have, like, secured orders, five billion dollars worth, including Coca-Cola wanting eight hundred trucks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nikola has secured truck orders worth $10 billion from companies led by Anheuser-Busch, which wants 800 of the companys non-polluting behemoths.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, five billion! That's, uh, pretty significant. And they're projecting sales to jump from $150 million in 2021 to $1.5 billion by 2024.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, five billion! That's, uh, pretty significant. And they're projecting sales to jump from one hundred fifty million dollars in twenty twenty one to one point five billion dollars by twenty twenty four.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, Nikola hasnt generated much revenue but estimates sales will jump from $150 million in 2021 to $3.2 billion by 2024 as it ramps up productions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, if they pull it off, is incredible. And the technology, you know, hydrogen fuel cells for heavy-duty trucks, especially long-haul?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, if they pull it off, is incredible. And the technology, you know, hydrogen fuel cells for heavy-duty trucks, especially long-haul?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the company has yet to deliver trucks to commercial customers, theres been a steady uptick in interest in hydrogen for heavy-duty trucks, particularly long-haul vehicles, as fuel cell power systems are much lighter than batteries and can be refueled about as fast as diesel and gasoline models.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because they're lighter than batteries and you can refuel them so fast, like, diesel. That's a game-changer for commercial.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because they're lighter than batteries and you can refuel them so fast, like, diesel. That's a game-changer for commercial.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...fuel cell power systems are much lighter than batteries and can be refueled about as fast as diesel and gasoline models.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, exactly. And the green hydrogen from water and renewables? That's, like, making it much more compelling now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. And the green hydrogen from water and renewables? That's, like, making it much more compelling now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While industrial hydrogen is typically sourced from natural gas, new methods for generating green hydrogen from water and electricity from solar or wind farms have made the fuel much more compelling to environmental regulators in California, Europe, Japan, South Korea and China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's been around since the 60s, but the costs have really come down. Milton is, uh, not shy about saying Nikola "disrupted the entire industry."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's been around since the sixty seconds, but the costs have really come down. Milton is, uh, not shy about saying Nikola disrupted the entire industry.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fuel cell technology... has been around since the 1960s, but earlier iterations were far too costly... costs for the materials and fuel tanks dropping steadily as the technology matured. ... What I love about Nikola is we've shown how to disrupt the entire industry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He's got that Elon Musk confidence, doesn't he? Saying hydrogen is the "hottest topic" because of them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's got that Elon Musk confidence, doesn't he? Saying hydrogen is the hottest topic because of them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At every (truck) group in the world now hydrogen is the hottest topic. And guess who did that? says Milton, who like Musk, isnt shy about boasting what his company can do. It was majority caused by Nikola

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He does! So, it's, uh, a really exciting, if ambitious, time for, you know, commercial trucking. We'll see how it all plays out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He does! So, it's, uh, a really exciting, if ambitious, time for, you know, commercial trucking. We'll see how it all plays out.
